definition: each does his utmost (idiom)/from each according to his means
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely
actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]
can/to be able to/might possibly/ability/(physics) energy

sentences.english: "From each according to his ability, to each according to his need" is a fundamentally good idea.
sentences.chinese: 各盡所能，按需分配從根本上說是個不錯的主意。

sentences.english: Doing our best for the common development. all company's of the members common goal.
sentences.chinese: 各盡所能共同發展是公司全體成員的共同目標。
